material.mattext: Compare and contrast the graduation rates distributions of the different colleges. Be sure to address center, spread and outliers.

Center:
Of the six colleges, college D has the highest median graduatation rate (M==79), followed by college F (M=72), B (M=70.15), C (M=67.65), A (M=63.75) and college E (M=59.15).

Spread:
College B has the smallest variation in graduation rates over the years (range = 9.4%, IQR = 4.5%). College D's graduation rates are also pretty consistent over the years (range = 10.5%, IQR = 7.75%). A larger variation in graduation rates is found in college E and C, and the least consistency in graduation rates (i.e., largest variation)is found in colleges A (range: 30.6%, IQR: 21.65%) and college F (range: 29.7%, IQR:22.07%).

None of the graduation rates distributions have outliers.
